programme.title: Wrongful Conviction
programme.desc: It’s estimated that roughly 10,000 people are wrongfully convicted in the U.S. each and every year for crimes they didn’t commit. These wrongful convictions mean that the real perpetrators may still be out there and that we all lose when the criminal justice system we rely on becomes corrupt.

programme.title: One Small Step
programme.desc: Oftentimes climate change and pollution can seem like unfathomably difficult problems to solve. Out host’s goal is to calm those fears by inviting the audience along with her as she strives to learn how to take action against the problems plaguing our planet. In One Small Step we explore how recycling works, where our waste goes, and how we can fix the planet through our actions as individuals. Hosted by Lucy Biggers, a growing influencer in the sustainability space.

programme.title: The River
programme.desc: A hundred miles south of Cairo, Bettany starts on a stretch of Nile that few visitors ever get to see. Once Egypt’s main highway, this was where Cleopatra herself used to travel and be seen by her people. Further upriver, Bettany tracks down Egypt’s lost emblem, the blue lotus flower, and visits the beautiful tombs where Tutankhamen’s discoverer Howard Carter first got hooked on Egypt.

programme.title: The Mouth
programme.desc: Bettany visits Egypt’s gateway to the world, the Nile’s mouth, before boarding her fabulous ‘dahabiya’ and meeting the crew that will guide her upriver the entire length of Egypt. Sailing south of Cairo, there’s time for Bettany to learn a few ropes onboard before she braves the underground tunnels of a collapsed pyramid, where the earliest known hieroglyphic writing can be found.

programme.title: The Wild Pacific
programme.desc: The Pacific ocean covers one third of our planet, more than all of the continents combined. For over 200 Million years, it has teemed with life, spawned new species, and launched global weather systems. This stunning work takes viewers into currents that swirl along kelp forests, coral reefs and seamounts, with sharks, whales, sea lions, vast schools of fish bursting from this ocean wilderness.

programme.title: Flying Rivers
programme.desc: From the heart of the Amazon rain forest to our European laboratories, climatologists, biologists and chemists are exploring and are starting to understand a mystery: the central role of forests in cloud formation. Spectacular images will illustrate a strong ecological message and increase awareness of the danger that deforestation represents for our planet.

programme.title: Secrets of the Chesterfield Islands
programme.desc: French cinematographer Christian Pétron takes us on an extraordinary journey of discovery and adventure to unravel the secrets of the Chesterfield Islands. This scientific detective story follows a unique expedition to this remote coral archipelago in the South Pacific, and for the very first time, the stunning underwater world of the Chesterfield Islands is revealed.

programme.title: Bama and the Lost Gorillas
programme.desc: Alfred Bama, an animal keeper from Cameroon, has an extraordinary connection with gorillas. “Nyango,” one of the gorillas he looks after, is the world's only Cross River gorilla in captivity. Until just a few years ago, this species was thought to be extinct. Now, Bama embarks on the greatest challenge of his life: locating Nyango’s family in the wild to protect them before it’s too late.

programme.desc: Tyler Jordan and Bryan Brown have been playing cat and mouse with "Big Heavy" throughout their Nebraska trip. During some midday downtime, Brown wins a bet with Jordan on a 50-yard shot to earn himself the right to be in the hot seat. The guys continue making adjustments to get close to the buck. It results in Brown tagging his biggest buck ever.

programme.title: Benelli Presents: Donnie Vincent’s Winds of Adak
programme.desc: In November of 2019, explorer and hunter Donnie Vincent traveled to Adak Island, Alaska. Located at the westernmost end in the Aleutian chain, Adak is wilderness with the exception of a now-abandoned naval base that once housed more than 6,000 people. Winds of Adak chronicles Donnie’s exploration of the island, a hauntingly desolate abandoned military outpost and three unique hunts—caribou, ptarmigan and sea ducks—as the unforgiving elements, the terrain and the Bering Sea test both man and equipment.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Josh Sneed - Live in the Dessert
programme.desc: Hailing from the great city of Cincinnati, Ohio, Josh comes to Dry Bar to bring “new life” to his comedy. Being funny 24/7 can be difficult, but Josh Sneed does it. Watch “Live in the Dessert” by Josh Sneed now!

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Steve Soelberg - Pirate Hymns
programme.desc: Steve Soelberg might actually be a human ray of sunshine. Riffing on his ultra-conservative upbringing, this special balances jokes about the tune of church hymns with hilarious observations of the seemingly mundane.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:BT - My Life As I Know It Now
programme.desc: With an act that crosses all boundaries, B.T. will surely have you rolling with laughter. His physical performance style and charm landed him two performances on NBC's Friday Night Videos and a performance at the prestigious HBO U.S. Comedy Arts Festival. B.T. has also appeared on BET’s Comic View, MTV's The Jenny McCarthy Show, and FOX's The Keenan Ivory Wayans Show.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Arvin Mitchell - Circus Purpose
programme.desc: With an array of impressions, stories, gestures and faces, Arvin’s memorable performance is sure to please. As the former co-host of BET’s Club Comic View, Arvin has been featured on Kevin Heart’s “One Mic Stand”, Tony Rocks “The Funny Spot” as well as entertaining our troops abroad. Nominated as one of NBC’s Stand Up for Diversity top comics Arvin continues to tour colleges, clubs, cruise ships & churches.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Drew Barth - Shoulda Tried Harder
programme.desc: Drew Barth is one of the fastest rising comedy stars in the Northwest. Born just outside the city of Seattle, what started as a dare in high school has become a full-time career. Drew Barth has risen through the ranks of local open mics to become a regular performer at comedy clubs, colleges, casinos and private events up and down the West Coast. After making the finals of the Seattle International Comedy Competition, Drew Barth spent a great deal of time in Los Angeles performing at clubs such as The Comedy Store, Laugh Factory, and The Improv, honing his craft.

programme.title: Brian Moote - Getting Schooled
programme.desc: Brian Moote started performing stand up in 2005 while he was working as a teacher in the Seattle School District. He then went to graduate school to get a masters degree in social work because who doesn't love crippling debt? I mean, this is America. After graduating he moved to LA and now tours the country telling jokes. He has made TV appearances on the USA Network's "Characters Welcome," Nickelodeon's "Nickmom's Nite Out," MTV's "Money from Strangers" and AXS TV's "Gotham Live." You should come out and see him tell jokes... DO IT!!!

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Seth Tippetts - Tall. Dark. Gigante
programme.desc: Get to know Seth from the chest down. He’s big, he’s tall, but most of all he’s hilarious. Check out this Utah-raised, clean, and semi-professional comedian today!

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Jeff Capri - Capricious
programme.desc: Jeff Capri uses his cynical perspective to riff on oxygen bars, playing darts to get in shape, and men taking their shirts off before fights.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Michael Palascak - 1984
programme.desc: Michael Palascak's dry humor shines with riffs on interviewing for a pyramid scheme, living with his parents after college, and how life is way better now than in 1984.

programme.title: Collin Moulton - Anti-Animal Vegan
programme.desc: Collin is one of the most fun, personable, and sought after headliners today. He has had his own stand-up special on SHOWTIME, he's been on NICKELODEON, and was recently featured on LAST CALL WITH CARSON DALY. Touring for over 15 years Collin has gained an ease and enjoyment on stage that makes every show worth watching.America knows and loves him. His familiarity and energy engages and relieves the audience before he even speaks. His electric storytelling style makes you care about every topic he explores. Collin's comedy is the release needed from our every day lives. Come needing to laugh tonight, leave wanting to laugh forever!Collin Moulton

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Jordan Makin - The BFFG
programme.desc: Born and raised in the heart of Utah County, Jordan Makin had to compensate for his red hair and uneventful childhood by learning to be funny. His unique observations will make you laugh and his stories about feeling awkward will help you appreciate your life more. He has worked with many comedy greats, such as Marc Maron, Ryan Hamilton, and Drew Lynch. His comedy has been featured at the Finger Lakes Comedy Festival and the Idaho Laugh Fest. Jordan is the co-creator and co-host of The Happy Valley Podcast.

programme.title: Ron Ruhman - Weird Stuff

programme.title: War of the Worlds
programme.desc: Astronomer George Herbert (C. Thomas Howell) is assigned to investigate reports of strange meteors crashing into earth near New York, Los Angeles and Washington, D.C. As the meteors land, enormous multi-limbed metal creatures disembark and begin destroying everything and everyone in their path with heat-ray guns. Amidst the apocalyptic destruction, Herbert teams with a soldier (Andy Lauer) and a pastor (Rhett Giles) on his journey into Washington to reunite with his family.

programme.title: Android Cop
programme.desc: In this futuristic, action-packed thriller, a cop and his robotic partner enter the Zone, a forbidden section of the city inhabited by a disease-stricken populace. From the ashes of a scorched village, Arkadi (Daniel Bonjour), an unassuming farm boy, embarks on an arduous journey to restore the lost pieces of a mystical amulet -- the only weapon powerful enough to destroy Krill. With the help of swordsman Maxim (Marc Singer) and his squire, Katya (Jennifer Dorogi), Arkadi struggles to save the world.
